CIRCULAR NO . 21 /  2003 
 
1. 
In partial modification of the AVSEC Order No. 2/2003  dated 20.1.2003 
regarding banned items, pickles (miscellaneous items)  are removed from the list 
of  banned items in hand baggage.  
 
 
2. 
In order to safeguard against carriage of any explosives camouflaged 
inside a container of pickles, x-ray screeners may familiarize themselves with the 
guidelines as mentioned in the Appendix – I (enclosed). 
 
 
 
(R.K. Singh) 
Addl. Commissioner of Security (CA) 
 
 
Distribution  as  per list  attached.
2:
Appendix - I 
 
 
Series of tests  conducted  with explosives/ IEDs mixed with pickles to find out  
their image on X-BIS revealed that: 
 
 
(i) 
When pickles are packed in glass bottles, the shape of the 
bottle can be easily seen and the pickles give a greenish colour. 
 
(ii) 
When pickles are packed in a glass bottle with explosives only,  
the image is a dark orange. This should be treated as a suspect 
image. 
 
(iii) 
When pickles are packed in a polythene bag/ bottle mixed with 
explosives, the image is dense brownish. This should also be 
treated as a suspect image. 
 
(iv) 
When pickles are packed with IEDs in glass bottle/ polythene 
bag, the components of IEDs like detonator, wire and battery 
can be easily distinguished. The image of the pickle will also be 
as in Sl. No. (ii) and (iii) above. 
 
(v) 
When suspicious images as elaborated in para (ii), (iii) and (iv) 
above appear, X-ray screeners must use various functional keys 
on the key board to analyse the images. In case of doubt such 
items should be physically checked. 
 
 
 
Ref : No. CAS-7(1) 97-Div-1  dated 09 July 2003
